text: everyone is Helen here today I will be
making Bank and your hell is a
Vietnamese thick noodle soup with pork
hock I'll make a few versions of pumpkin
before the version will fish cake and
crabs you can click here to watch that
video if you haven't watched already
like many other Vietnamese noodle soup
to me is like comfort food I can eat it
for breakfast for lunch and dinner the
weather is getting really cold these
days so I'm gonna cook this soup to warm
me up let's begin
firstly we need to pop boy the pot
and the pop ones to reduce the strong
smell place in a large saucepan and feel
with enough water to cover then add some
salt and vinegar by for about five
minutes to let all the impurities right
to the top then them out the whole pot
and rinse the bones well if you use the
same pot again make sure you wash it
clean as well do the same with the pot
bones then play the pot hock and the
bones in a large pot fill with enough
water to cover at one peeled onion two
slices ginger and a tablespoon of salt
you can also chat a ginger and onion to
make it more fragrant then cook for
about an hour until the pork hock is
tender I use a pressure cooker to save
time it took me about 30 minutes then
remove the pork hock soak it in ice cold
water to prevent blackening then bring
and slide into bite-sized pieces add
salt fish sauce sugar and chicken stock
to your taste I also add 2 tablespoons
of fried shallots to add more flavour it
depends on your preference you can
either put the noodle into the bowl and
ladle the soup over or add the noodle
directly into the soup pot then transfer
to a serving bowl top with a few slices
of pork hock and chopped coriander also
add some chili oil or a natural oil to
make it look more tempting click on the
picture if you want to know how I make
the Lunetta oil now it's ready to serve
I love to eat bun come with some
homemade fried bread sticks ban quai if
you want me to make a video for the
fried bread sticks as well just click
like or I leave a comment below
just dip it in the soup and enjoy it
goes really well with the soup the
noodles are thick soft and rather short
so you can easily eat with a spoon
rather than chopsticks it's a rather
simple noodle soup but still very tasty
I hope you like it don't forget to
thumbs up and subscribe thank you for
watching bye
